title: Treasure Trails

properties.name: description
properties.value: Treasure Trails is a Distraction and Diversion which involves solving clue scrolls, rarely dropped items dropped by the majority of monsters in RuneScape. Clue scrolls contain clues and riddles for the player to solve to eventually find a reward casket, which could contain unique rewards. A clue scroll can be obtained randomly from killing monsters, playing minigames, looting implings, fishing, woodcutting, or mining.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Treasure Trails
 This article has a strategy guide here.
All information on mechanics and strategy will be on this page.
This is a dangerous activity.
On death, all unprotected items will be moved to a grave. Hardcore Ironmen will lose their status, and any items stored in any Item Retrieval Service will be deleted.
"TT" redirects here. For the minigame in Morytania, see Temple Trekking. For the quest, see The Tourist Trap.
Treasure Trails
Released 5 May 2004 (Update)
Type Distraction and Diversion
Members No
Location Global
Reward currency No
Music Box of Delights (Mimic)

Treasure Trails is a Distraction and Diversion which involves solving clue scrolls, rarely dropped items dropped by the majority of monsters in RuneScape. Clue scrolls contain clues and riddles for the player to solve to eventually find a reward casket, which could contain unique rewards. A clue scroll can be obtained randomly from killing monsters, playing minigames, looting implings, fishing, woodcutting, or mining.

There are six different levels of clue scrolls. The higher level ones being more difficult to complete. Players can own up to one clue scroll of each level at a time.

It should be noted that if a player dies in the Wilderness with a clue scroll (or reward casket) in level 20 or higher Wilderness and it is not one of the top 3 kept items (or top 4 with Protect Item prayer) or is not protected by a clue box (in which case the player will lose the box but keep the scroll), the clue scroll will disappear, regardless of whether it's a PvP death or not. In lower Wilderness however (level 20 or lower), in PvP death, an unprotected clue scroll will stay on the ground for up to one hour. Players may find it beneficial to carry a Wilderness Sword (to cut webs), Royal Seed Pod/Teleport Crystal and/or an Explorer's Ring, as clue scrolls are always kept above these items; these however will be lost upon death and duplicates are easily obtainable.

If players die to a monster outside of the wilderness they will always keep their clue scroll, whether protected or not, as it is an untradeable item.

There is no fixed location for Treasure Trails, the clue scrolls may send you throughout the whole of Gielinor. Therefore it is recommended to have access to as many teleports and transportation systems as possible.

Contents

  • 1 Difficulty levels
  • 2 Solving the Treasure Trails
  • 3 STASH units
  • 4 Possible rewards
    • 4.1 Universal rewards
    • 4.2 Beginner rewards
    • 4.3 Easy rewards

    • 4.6 Elite rewards
    • 4.7 Master rewards
  • 5 Average rewards value
  • 6 Ranks
  • 7 Changes
  • 8 References

Difficulty levels[edit | edit source]

Clue scrolls have six types of difficulty levels, these are: beginner, easy, medium, hard, elite and master. More difficult trails provide more valuable rewards.

Only one clue scroll of the same difficulty may be in a player's possession at a time, however it is possible to possess multiple scrolls of different difficulties each. If one of your clue scrolls is still on the ground, it is possible to receive additional scrolls of the same difficulty as drops; if this happens, it is possible to complete both scrolls by leaving one on the ground and switching off between steps.

Some clues will require access to areas which may require quests, will require items that need a certain skill requirement in order to wear, wield or access, or will give a skill challenge that requires a certain level in that skill. The table below links to pages with all requirements. Temporary skill boosts can be used for most non-combat skill challenges.

Tier Length Guide Requirements Drop sources Rewards
Beginner 1-3 steps Beginner clues guide Requirements List of sources Reward casket
Easy 2-4 steps Easy clues guide Requirements List of sources Reward casket
Medium 3-5 steps Medium clues guide Requirements List of sources Reward casket
Hard 4-6 steps Hard clues guide Requirements List of sources Reward casket
Elite 5-7 steps Elite clues guide Requirements List of sources Reward casket
Master 6-8 steps Master clues guide Requirements List of sources Reward casket

See the table below for links to the pages with solutions for each clue.

STASH units[edit | edit source]

Main article: STASH

STASH units (short for "Store Things And Stuff Here"), also known as hidey holes, are storage units for emote clue items, saving bank space and bank trips for players who do Treasure Trails frequently.

There are 107 STASH units in total found throughout RuneScape. These locations are initially labelled as inconspicuous bushes/crates/holes/rocks, and, once built, become usable STASH units. Players can check which units they've already built/filled by visiting Watson and reading the noticeboard within his house.

Depending on the scenery the emote clue is located in, STASH may differ in appearance to appear as inconspicuous as possible. For a list of the locations of all STASH units as well as its building materials, visit this page.

Inconspicuous objects
Bush Crate Hole Rocks
Constructed STASH units
Bush Crate Hole Rocks

Possible rewards[edit | edit source]

Treasure Trail complete!
The music that plays upon completing a Treasure Trail.

There are a total of 638 Unique rewards from all tiers of Clue scrolls. Starting with Hard Clues rewards may also include increasing access to items from the Mega Rare drop table such as Gilded Armour or Third Age equipment.

Universal rewards[edit | edit source]

Universal rewards are only available from easy Treasure Trails and above.[1]

Image Description
10,000-15,000 coins.
God pages for God books.
God blessings
Gnomish firelighters.
Charge dragonstone jewellery scrolls
Purple sweets
Teleport scrolls
Master scroll book
Clue scroll (master)

Main article: Reward casket (beginner)

As well as unique Treasure Trails rewards, players may also receive a variety of items. A more detailed overview of all possible rewards can be found at reward casket (beginner).

Ranks[edit | edit source]

A player may check the amount of Treasure Trails they have completed by clicking on the Treasure Trail Statistics or by checking the Adventure log in their Player-owned house. These interfaces also show the player's Treasure Trails rank.

Completed clue scrolls Rank
0-100 Beginner
101-200 Novice
201-400 The Explorer
401-600 Treasure Hunter
601-1000 Expert
1,001-1,500 Elite
1,501-2,000 Master
2,001+ Legend

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
17 February 2021
(update)

Two new elite Treasure Trail steps were added.

8 October 2015
(update)

Increased the zone check for an emote clue at the Observatory.

2 July 2015
(update | poll)

All clue scrolls now have a right-click 'Check steps' option that will allow you to see exactly how many steps you have completed so far.

18 June 2015
(update)

You will now be able to have up to one clue scroll of each tier and will be able to complete clue scrolls of different tiers simultaneously.

22 January 2015
(update)

You can no longer receive a clue scroll if Priestess Zul-Gwenwynig is protecting one for you.

17 July 2014
(update | poll)
  • Lumberyard teleport scrolls are now available as clue scroll rewards.
  • Clue scrolls and caskets can no longer be picked up on F2P worlds.
19 June 2014
(update | poll)

You can no longer receive a clue scroll drop if you have a skill challenge scroll. Appended text on various clue scrolls to make them a little clearer. Fixed a few clue scroll typos.

12 June 2014
(update)
  • Elite clue drops have been added as a drop from high level monsters.
  • Patchy is now able to combine some clue scroll rewards.
  • The toybox in your player owned house was updated to store new rewards
  • Some clue scroll rewards have been renamed to be more easily searchable
  • When you complete a clue scroll the game will now tell you how many of each tier of clue you've completed. This is also shown at the observatory.
1 May 2014
(update)

Clue scrolls are now universally dropped in addition to other drops rather than instead of them.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 9 May 2019. (Archived from the original on 15 July 2019.) Mod Ash: "They only give F2P items."

For the quest, see [[The Tourist Trap]]}} {{Infobox Activity |name = Treasure Trails |image = [[File:Treasure trail reward.png|300px]] |release = [[5 May]] [[2004]] |update = Bigger Banks & Treasure Trails |type = Distraction and Diversion |members = No |location = Global |currency = No |music = [[Box of Delights]] ([[Mimic]]) |map = No }} [[File:Treasure Trails logo.jpg|left]] '''Treasure Trails''' is a [[Distraction and Diversion]] which involves solving [[clue scroll]]s, rarely dropped items dropped by the majority of monsters in ''[[RuneScape]]''. Clue scrolls contain clues and riddles for the player to solve to eventually find a [[reward casket]], which could contain unique rewards. A clue scroll can be obtained randomly from killing monsters, playing minigames, looting [[impling]]s, [[Clue bottle|fishing]], [[Clue nest|woodcutting]], or [[Clue geode|mining]]. There are six different levels of clue scrolls. The higher level ones being more difficult to complete. Players can own up to one clue scroll of each level at a time. It should be noted that if a player dies in the [[Wilderness]] with a clue scroll (or [[reward casket]]) in level 20 or higher Wilderness and it is not one of the top 3 kept items (or top 4 with [[Protect Item]] prayer) or is not protected by a [[clue box]] (in which case the player will lose the box but keep the scroll), the clue scroll will disappear, regardless of whether it's a PvP death or not. In lower Wilderness however (level 20 or lower), in PvP death, an unprotected clue scroll will stay on the ground for up to one hour. Players may find it beneficial to carry a [[Wilderness sword 1|Wilderness Sword]] (to cut webs), [[Royal seed pod|Royal Seed Pod]]/[[Teleport crystal|Teleport Crystal]] and/or an [[Explorer's ring 1|Explorer's Ring]], as clue scrolls are always kept above these items; these however will be lost upon death and duplicates are easily obtainable. If players die to a monster outside of the wilderness they will always keep their clue scroll, whether protected or not, as it is an untradeable item. There is no fixed location for Treasure Trails, the clue scrolls may send you throughout the whole of [[Gielinor]]. Therefore it is recommended to have access to as many [[Teleportation|teleports]] and [[Transportation|transportation systems]] as possible. {{ToC|limit=2}}{{Clear}} ==Difficulty levels== [[Clue scroll]]s have six types of difficulty levels, these are: beginner, easy, medium, hard, elite and master. More difficult trails provide more valuable rewards. Only one clue scroll of the same difficulty may be in a player's possession at a time, however it is possible to possess multiple scrolls of different difficulties each. If one of your clue scrolls is still on the ground, it is possible to receive additional scrolls of the same difficulty as drops; if this happens, it is possible to complete both scrolls by leaving one on the ground and switching off between steps. Some clues will require access to areas which may require quests, will require items that need a certain skill requirement in order to wear, wield or access, or will give a skill challenge that requires a certain level in that skill. boxes|Solutions]] |} ==STASH units== {{Main|STASH}} STASH units (short for "Store Things And Stuff Here"), also known as hidey holes, are storage units for [[emote clue]] items, saving [[bank]] space and bank trips for players who do Treasure Trails frequently. There are 107 STASH units in total found throughout ''RuneScape''. These locations are initially labelled as inconspicuous bushes/crates/holes/rocks, and, once built, become usable STASH units. Players can check which units they've already built/filled by visiting [[Watson]] and reading the [[noticeboard]] within his [[Watson's house|house]]. Depending on the scenery the emote clue is located in, STASH may differ in appearance to appear as inconspicuous as possible. For a list of the locations of all STASH units as well as its building materials, visit [[STASH#List_of_STASH_units|this page]]. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" ! colspan="4" |Inconspicuous objects |- !Bush !Crate !Hole !Rocks |- |[[File:Bush scenery.png|80px]] |[[File:Inconspicuous crate.png|80px]] |[[File:Inconspicuous hole.png|100px]] |[[File:Inconspicuous rocks.png|100px]] |- ! colspan="4" |Constructed STASH units |- !Bush !Crate !Hole !Rocks |- |[[File:STASH unit (bush).png|80px]] |[[File:STASH unit (crate).png|80px]] |[[File:STASH unit (hole).png|100px]] |[[File:STASH unit (rock).png|100px]] |} ==Possible rewards== {{Listen|filename=Treasure Trail complete.ogg|align=right|title=Treasure Trail complete!|desc=The music that plays upon completing a Treasure Trail.}} There are a total of 638 Unique rewards from all tiers of Clue scrolls. Starting with Hard Clues rewards may also include increasing access to items from the Mega Rare drop table such as Gilded Armour or Third Age equipment. ===Universal rewards=== Universal rewards are only available from easy Treasure Trails and above.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1126491427343601664|date=9 May 2019|archiveurl=https://archive.fo/BzIe7|archivedate=15 July 2019|quote=They only give F2P items.|name=Mod Ash tweet}} {{Universal rewards}} ===Beginner rewards=== {{Main|Reward casket (beginner)}} {{Clue scroll (beginner)/Rewards}} ===Easy rewards=== {{Main|Reward casket (easy)}} {{Clue scroll (easy)/Rewards}} ===Medium rewards=== {{Main|Reward casket (medium)}} {{Clue scroll (medium)/Rewards}} ===Hard rewards=== {{Main|Reward casket (hard)}} {{Clue scroll (hard)/Rewards}} ===Elite rewards=== {{Main|Reward casket (elite)}} {{Clue scroll (elite)/Rewards}} ===Master rewards=== {{Main|Reward casket (master)}} {{Clue scroll (master)/Rewards}} ==Average rewards value== For the average value of each completed clue scroll, see the table below. {| class="wikitable align-center-1 align-center-5" |+ ! colspan=2 |Tier !Average gp
per roll !Average gp
per clue ! colspan=2 |Milestone reward !Clue scrolls
required |- |{{plinkt|Clue scroll (beginner)|txt=Beginner}} |{{Coins|floor({{BeginnerClueValue}})}} |{{Coins|floor(2 * {{BeginnerClueValue}})}} |{{plinkt|Explore|pic=Explore emote icon}} |600 |- |{{plinkt|Clue scroll (easy)|txt=Easy}} |{{Coins|floor({{EasyClueValue}})}} |{{Coins|floor(3 * {{EasyClueValue}})}} |{{plinkt|Large spade}} |500 |- |{{plinkt|Clue scroll (medium)|txt=Medium}} |{{Coins|floor({{MediumClueValue}})}} |{{Coins|floor(4 * {{MediumClueValue}})}} |{{plinkt|Clueless scroll}} |400 |- |{{plinkt|Clue scroll (hard)|txt=Hard}} |{{Coins|floor({{HardClueValue}})}} |{{Coins|floor(5 * {{HardClueValue}})}} |{{plinkt|Uri transform|pic=Uri transform emote icon}} |300 |- |{{plinkt|Clue scroll (elite)|txt=Elite}} |{{Coins|floor({{EliteClueValue}})}} |{{Coins|floor(5 * {{EliteClueValue}})}} |{{plinkt|Heavy casket}} |200 |- |{{plinkt|Clue scroll (master)|txt=Master}} |{{Coins|floor({{MasterClueValue}})}} |{{Coins|floor(6 * {{MasterClueValue}})}} |{{plinkt|Scroll sack}} |100 |} ==Ranks== A player may check the amount of Treasure Trails they have completed by clicking on the [[Treasure Trail Statistics]] or by checking the [[Achievement_Gallery#Adventure_log|Adventure log]] in their [[Player-owned house]]. These interfaces also show the player's Treasure Trails rank. {| class="wikitable" |+ !Completed clue scrolls !Rank |- |0-100 |Beginner |- |101-200 |Novice |- |201-400 |The Explorer |- |401-600 |Treasure Hunter |- |601-1000 |Expert |- |1,001-1,500 |Elite |- |1,501-2,000 |Master |- |2,001+ |Legend |} ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = 17 February 2021 |update = The Isle of Souls |change = Two new elite Treasure Trail steps were added. }} {{Subject changes |date = 8 October 2015 |update = Smoke Battlestaff Buff |change = Increased the zone check for an emote clue at the Observatory. }} {{Subject changes |date = 2 July 2015 |update = Clue Scroll Step Counter |poll = Old School Content Poll 34: XP droplets & Slayer |change = All clue scrolls now have a right-click 'Check steps' option that will allow you to see exactly how many steps you have completed so far. }} {{Subject changes |date = 18 June 2015 |update = Multiple Clues & Midsummer |change = You will now be able to have up to one clue scroll of each tier and will be able to complete clue scrolls of different tiers simultaneously. }} {{Subject changes |date = 22 January 2015 |update = Zulrah, Bank Space & More |change = You can no longer receive a clue scroll if Priestess Zul-Gwenwynig is protecting one for you. }} {{Subject changes |date = 17 July 2014 |update = Boss Pets and Spawn Rates |poll = Old School feature poll - Content Poll 22 |change = *Lumberyard teleport scrolls are now available as clue scroll rewards. *Clue scrolls and caskets can no longer be picked up on F2P worlds. }} {{Subject changes |date = 19 June 2014 |update = Clan Wars is here! |poll = Old School feature poll 19 |change = You can no longer receive a clue scroll drop if you have a skill challenge scroll. Appended text on various clue scrolls to make them a little clearer. Fixed a few clue scroll typos. }} {{Subject changes |date = 12 June 2014 |update = Treasure Trail Expansion |change = *Elite clue drops have been added as a drop from high level monsters. *Patchy is now able to combine some clue scroll rewards. *The toybox in your player owned house was updated to store new rewards *Some clue scroll rewards have been renamed to be more easily searchable *When you complete a clue scroll the game will now tell you how many of each tier of clue you've completed. This is also shown at the observatory. }} {{Subject changes |date = 1 May 2014 |update = Spirit trees, clues & more! |change = Clue scrolls are now universally dropped in addition to other drops rather than instead of them. }} {{Subject changes footer}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Treasure Trails}} {{DnD}}
